thread.title: Portland bank robbery suspect spotted by FBI agents at Starbucks, gets arrested
thread.title_full: Portland bank robbery suspect spotted by FBI agents at Starbucks, gets arrested | OregonLive.com

author: Everton Bailey Jr. | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Portland bank robbery suspect spotted by FBI agents at Starbucks, gets arrested
text:
Timmie Smith Multnomah County Sheriff's Office FBI agents arrested a suspected bank robber when he showed up at a Starbucks a few blocks away from the bureau's Portland office on Tuesday, authorities say. One agent recognized 58-year-old Timmie L. Smith as a suspect identified in surveillance photos in a robbery last Wednesday at a Wells Fargo at 1900 S.W. 5th Ave. and a second Wells Fargo heist Monday at 900 S.W. 5th Ave. , according to the FBI.
Smith is accused of fleeing with a combined $2,820 from the downtown Portland banks after passing notes to tellers demanding money, a criminal complaint filed in federal court said. While he was being arrested, Smith reportedly asked the agents, "What took you so long?"
"I want to go back to prison. I don't want to be let out," Smith said, according to the complaint.
Smith appeared before a judge in federal court Wednesday and was ordered to be held in jail on suspicion of bank robbery. He is scheduled to appear in court Nov. 2.
-- Everton Bailey Jr.
ebailey@oregonian.com
